item.title: Need help coding!
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

I’m sorry to say Jorgen but explaining that to him was a complete waste of time, Also as for the comment “Staff do not like copy and paste tutorials…”, I ask of you to take a look in the “RS2 Tutorial” section. I am also looking into this for implementing it into rscd source, i’m going to maybe incorperate 2 worlds. Shouldn’t be too difficult…

Read full topic

item.title: Need help coding!
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

There are many ways you can go about doing this, and I can give an example, however, I will not show any code. The staff on these forums really does not like ‘Copy and Paste’ tutorial-approaches, as such you normally won’t learn anything, unless you know how to program in general. But as an example, you could always find the place in the source-code that handles the attacking of a player, and check whether the opponent is within a certain boundary. If so is the case, the attack-proceedure will be cancelled, and an appropriate message can be shown. If the opponent is not within this boundary, the attack-proceedure will continue as normal. I am sure there are better ways of doing this, but as told, this is just a simple example…

Read full topic
